IOT.IOTClient.UDPBroadcastService

Class UDPBroadcastService

  • java.lang.Object
    • IOT.IOTClient.UDPBroadcastService.UDPBroadcastService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UDPBroadcastServiceInterface, java.lang.Runnable

    public class UDPBroadcastService
extends java.lang.Object
implements UDPBroadcastServiceInterface
    The UDP broadcaster is responsible for flooding the network with service offerings, which are to be received by the UDP Listener.
    Version:
    Milestone1
    Author:
    Mai

    • Field Detail

      • BROADCAST_MESSAGE_INTERVAL

        public static final int BROADCAST_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
        The interval between UDP broadcasts (in milliseconds).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • port

        private java.lang.Integer port
        The port on which to broadcast.

      • running

        private java.lang.Boolean running
        True indicates the broadcaster is actively sending datagrams on the specified port. False indicates the broadcaster has stopped, either by the method terminate() terminate) or by an error. Default is false (null if constructor has not been called yet).

      • socket

        private java.net.DatagramSocket socket
        The socket to which the sending is bound. Defaults to null until the run-method is called.

      • message

        private java.lang.String message
        The message that will be broadcast.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDPBroadcastService

        public UDPBroadcastService(java.lang.Integer port,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Creates a new instance of UDPBroadcastService. It automatically sets "listening" to false; "socket" will be initialized by the "run" method.
        Parameters:
        port - The port on which to broadcast.
        message - The message that will be broadcast.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This methods starts the UDP Broadcast Service. As destination-IP serves the multicast-IP 255.255.255.255. The service will continually flood the network with messages until it is terminated by external methods or errors. This method can only be called ONCE.
        Specified by:
        run in interface UDPBroadcastServiceInterface
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the run-method has already been called before.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminates the broadcaster by setting "running" to false. Also does resource cleanup.
        Specified by:
        terminate in interface UDPBroadcastServiceInterface

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the broadcaster's state (if running, and if known, on which address)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Debug method.
        Parameters:
        args - No arguments.
